newsitem.title: UK: Euro barges recover to $82 fob, other grades quiet.
newsitem.headline: Euro barges recover to $82 fob, other grades quiet.

text.p: European high sulphur barge prices picked up on Thursday from previous day lows but trade was still thin, traders said.
Deals were done mainly at $82 fob ARA, with a little at $82.50 and bunker demand was reported as moderate.
"The bunkers were rather healthy for this week but were moderate in absolute terms," said one trader.

The sharp price swings over the last two days have unsettled some in the market, with low volumes making values particularly prone to volatility. Barges were traded as high as $87 on Tuesday and hit a low of $79.50 on Wednesday.
High sulphur cargoes were little discussed although bids of $77 and $78 cif were reported heard in the market. Buyers were complaining the market was being artificially propped up.
"The numbers are now more used to price other deals than to set a value for real activity," said one player.
Portugal's state electricity company announced results of its high sulphur cracked tender, with state refiner Petrogal heard to have won one 25,000 tonne cargo and a U.S. refiner/trader another.
The market believed the prices were around mean of mean NWE fob and mean Med fob plus $7.50 or $8.00.
Low sulphur cracked markets were again very quiet. - London newsroom +44 171 542 8060
